author: Baha'u'llah
source_text: دُ النُّفُوسُ وَتَثْمُرُ أَشْجارُ الوُجُودِ، أَيْ رَبِّ قَدْ اصْفَرَّ نَباتُ قُلُوبِ أَحِبَّتِكَ فَأَمْطِرْ عَلَيهِمْ مِنْ سَحَابِ المَعَانِي ما يُنْبِتُ مِنْ صُدُورِهِمْ كَلأُ عِلْمِكَ وَحِكْمَتِكَ، ثُمَّ اسْرُرْهُمْ بِإِظْهارِ أَمْرِكَ وَاسْتِعْلآءِ
translation: The plants that have sprung forth, O my Lord, in the hearts of Thy loved ones have withered away. Send down upon them, from the clouds of Thy spirit, that which will cause the tender herbs of Thy knowledge and wisdom to grow within their breasts. Rejoice, then, their hearts with the proclamation of Thy Cause and the exaltation of Thy sovereignty.
